subject: Data
title: Indexes: The Secret to Fast Queries
description: A short lesson to help you apply Indexes: The Secret to Fast Queries.

hook.text: A query on a million-row table takes 30 seconds. Add one index. It takes 3 milliseconds.

buildup.text: A database index is like a book's index â€” a sorted structure that lets the database jump directly to matching rows.

discovery.text: B-tree indexes organize data in a balanced tree structure, enabling searches in logarithmic time instead of linear.

twist.text: Indexes speed reads but slow writes â€” every insert must update the index too. Too many indexes can backfire.

climax.text: Choosing the right indexes is the single most impactful performance optimization in database management.

punchline.text: An index turns a full table scan into a precision lookup.

quiz.question: What is the trade-off of database indexes?
options: They use more memory but less disk
They speed up reads but slow down writes
